intro: Barleria consanguinea, commonly known as the red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular red flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Barleria consanguinea is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
